com.avnera.smartdigitalheadset

Interface Bluetooth.Delegate

  • Enclosing class:
    Bluetooth

    public static interface Bluetooth.Delegate
    The Bluetooth.Delegate interface defines methods that will be called from a Bluetooth instance to inform an interested object (typically the entity that creates the Bluetooth class) of changes to the Bluetooth instance's state. Note: All delegate methods are called from an ad-hoc, non-main thread.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void bluetoothAdapterChangedState(Bluetooth bluetooth, int currentState, int previousState)
      A Bluetooth instance calls bluetoothAdapterChangedState() to notify its delegate that a BluetoothAdapter.ACTION_STATE_CHANGED message has been received.
      void bluetoothDeviceBondStateChanged(Bluetooth bluetooth, BluetoothDevice device, int currentState, int previousState)
      A Bluetooth instance calls bluetoothDeviceBondStateChanged() when a BluetoothDevice.ACTION_BOND_STATE_CHANGED message is received.
      void bluetoothDeviceConnected(Bluetooth bluetooth, BluetoothDevice device, BluetoothSocket socket)
      A Bluetooth instance calls bluetoothDeviceConnected() when a BluetoothDevice is physically connected.
      void bluetoothDeviceDisconnected(Bluetooth bluetooth, BluetoothDevice device, boolean willAutoReconnect)
      A Bluetooth instance calls bluetoothDeviceDisconnected() when a BluetoothDevice is physically disconnected.
      void bluetoothDeviceDiscovered(Bluetooth bluetooth, BluetoothDevice device)
      A Bluetooth instance calls bluetoothDeviceDiscovered() when the Bluetooth instance has been put into discovery mode and a new Bluetooth device is discovered.

    • Method Detail

      • bluetoothAdapterChangedState

        void bluetoothAdapterChangedState(Bluetooth bluetooth,
                                  int currentState,
                                  int previousState)
        A Bluetooth instance calls bluetoothAdapterChangedState() to notify its delegate that a BluetoothAdapter.ACTION_STATE_CHANGED message has been received. See the documentation for BluetoothAdapter.ACTION_STATE_CHANGED and BluetoothAdapter.EXTRA_STATE for more information on the types of values that can be passed to this function.
        Parameters:
        bluetooth - The Bluetooth instance calling bluetoothAdapterChangedState()
        currentState - The value of the EXTRA_STATE field (e.g. STATE_OFF, etc.)
        previousState - The value of the EXTRA_PREVIOUS_STATE field (e.g. STATE_OFF, etc.)

      • bluetoothDeviceBondStateChanged

        void bluetoothDeviceBondStateChanged(Bluetooth bluetooth,
                                     BluetoothDevice device,
                                     int currentState,
                                     int previousState)
        A Bluetooth instance calls bluetoothDeviceBondStateChanged() when a BluetoothDevice.ACTION_BOND_STATE_CHANGED message is received. When currentState equals BluetoothDevice.BOND_BONDED the peripheral device is paired and connect() can be called.
        Parameters:
        bluetooth - The Bluetooth instance calling bluetoothDeviceBondStateChanged()
        device - The BluetoothDevice that for which the state is being returned.
        currentState - The BluetoothDevice's current bond state
        previousState - The BluetoothDevice's previous bond state

      • bluetoothDeviceConnected

        void bluetoothDeviceConnected(Bluetooth bluetooth,
                              BluetoothDevice device,
                              BluetoothSocket socket)
        A Bluetooth instance calls bluetoothDeviceConnected() when a BluetoothDevice is physically connected. The socket should be used to create a BluetoothSocketWrapper for a LightX instance.
        Parameters:
        bluetooth - The Bluetooth instance calling bluetoothDeviceConnected()
        device - The BluetoothDevice that is connected
        socket - The connected socket. Create a BluetoothSocketWrapper with this socket and hand it off to a new LightX instance.

      • bluetoothDeviceDisconnected

        void bluetoothDeviceDisconnected(Bluetooth bluetooth,
                                 BluetoothDevice device,
                                 boolean willAutoReconnect)
        A Bluetooth instance calls bluetoothDeviceDisconnected() when a BluetoothDevice is physically disconnected. The disconnect may be recoverable (such as a transitory out-of-range issue), or may not be (such as a peer-related socket error). If the error is recoverable the willAutoReconnect flag will be set to true and the connection will be automatically reestablished when the device becomes available. Otherwise, willAutoReconnect will be false and it will be as if disconnect() was called on the Bluetooth device. In this case a manual connect() call should be reissued when the device returns.
        Parameters:
        bluetooth - The Bluetooth instance calling bluetoothDeviceDisconnected()
        device - The BluetoothDevice that is disconnected
        willAutoReconnect - true if the Bluetooth instance will attempt to automatically reestablish the connection, false otherwise.

      • bluetoothDeviceDiscovered

        void bluetoothDeviceDiscovered(Bluetooth bluetooth,
                               BluetoothDevice device)
        A Bluetooth instance calls bluetoothDeviceDiscovered() when the Bluetooth instance has been put into discovery mode and a new Bluetooth device is discovered.
        Parameters:
        bluetooth - The Bluetooth instance calling bluetoothDeviceDiscovered()
        device - The BluetoothDevice that was discovered
